faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
The course covers the following topics:
1.	Test design. 
2.	Test planning.
3.	Teamwork aspects of testing.
description.et:
Aines kaetakse järgmised teemad: 
1.	Testi disain
2.	Testi planeerimine
3.	Meeskonnatöö aspektid testimisel

objectives.en: This course aims at providing students with an opportunity to apply software testing concepts and techniques in a hands-on manner.
objectives.et: Selle kursuse eesmärk on anda tudengitele võimalus rakendada tarkvara testimise kontseptsioone ja tehnikaid praktilise tegevuse käigus.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of this course, a student will:
learning_outcomes.et: Pärast kursuse edukat läbimist oskab üliõpilane:

learning_outcomes.en: 1.	Be aware of social aspects of software testing
2.	Select and apply suitable testing techniques within a given software project
learning_outcomes.et: 2.	Valida ja rakendada konkreetsele tarkvaraprojektile sobivaid testimise tehnikaid.

learning_outcomes.en: 3.	Apply effective techniques for conflict resolution in a software testing environment
learning_outcomes.et: 3.	Rakendada effektiivseid tehnikaid konfliktide lahendamiseks tarkvara testimise keskkonnas.

learning_outcomes.en: 4.	Create and defend a software testing plan that takes into account multiple dimensions of software quality
learning_outcomes.et: 4.	Luua ja põhjendada tarkvara testimise plaani, mis võtab mitmekülgselt uurimisele tarkvara kvaliteedi.

independent_work.et: The instructions are given by every lecturer

description.et: Assignments should be submitted on time and satisfy the requirements

grade_preconditions.et:
To pass this course, a students has to:
*actively participate in at least 6 out of 7 seminar sessions. First and last seminar attendance is compulsory.
*complete all homeworks (from which most are done with a group) to a level that demonstrates attainment of the learning objectives.

grade_evaluation.et:
To pass this course, a students has to:
*actively participate in at least 6 out of 7 seminar sessions. First and last seminar attendance is compulsory.
*complete all homework (from which most are done with a group) to a level that demonstrates attainment of the learning objectives.

resources.mandatory_materials: The readings for every topic could be found on page http://moodle.ut.ee
resources.recommended_materials: The readings for every topic could be found on page http://moodle.ut.ee

description.et:
Session 1. Introduction to testing. Oracles, heuristics and their limitations.
Attendance of this session is compulsory.
Session 2. Heuristics and Oracles. Product Mapping and Test Planning.
Session 6. Teamwork and Communication. Tester's Task and Time Management.

Session 7. Presentations of work done.  Conclusive exercise which covers all topics of previous sessions.
Attendance of this session is compulsory.
